content:
I am currently working toward the M.Sc. degree in Control Science and Engineering with School of Automation Science and Electrical Engineering, Beihang University, directed by Prof. Xiwang Dong in Prof. Zhang Ren‚Äôs lab. My research interests focus on motion planning for mobile robots.
üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I am actively seeking for a Ph.D. position in Robotics for the fall of 2024.
üéì In June 2021, I received the B. Eng. degree in Automatic Control with an outstanding graduate award from Beihang University, Beijing, China.
summary: I am currently working toward the M.Sc. degree in Control Science and Engineering with School of Automation Science and Electrical Engineering, Beihang University, directed by Prof. Xiwang Dong in Prof. Zhang Ren‚Äôs lab.
title: Yicheng Chen

summary: \[**In submission with ICRA 2024**] We introduce the Learning-Initialized Trajectory Planner (LIT-Planner), a novel approach that guides optimization using a Neural Network (NN) Planner to provide initial values.
title: Learning-Initialized Trajectory Planning in Unknown Environments

content:
Aeriva - This name is a combination of ‚Äúaero‚Äù (meaning air) and ‚Äúdiva‚Äù (suggesting a stylish and confident personality).
In March 2023, I began to design, assemble, and test this drone from scratch. So far, four drones of this type have been made and used in various scientific research and competitions in my lab.
Features Agile and safe: Aeriva is built upon a 3.5-inch cinewhoop frame with Kakute H7 mini flight controller, making it exceptionally agile, compact and safe.
High computing performance: Aeriva is equipped with NVIDIA Jetson Orin NX, facilitating it with strong onboard computing capabilities.
Specifications Component Specs Computer NVIDIA Jetson Orin NX Camera Intel RealSense D435 Stack Kakute H7 mini + Tekko32 F4 4in1 mini 45A ESC Dimension 152mm motor-to-motor Motors RCinpower GTS V3 2104-T-1800kv Propellers Gemfan D90S Battery 6S 1200mah 150C Accomplishments based on Aeriva Scientific research:
Learning-Initialized Trajectory Planning in Unknown Environments Competitions:
Huashan UAV challenge: I led a team of six students and won the championship.
summary: I designed and assembled this safe and agile 3.5-inch drone. It has been used in various scientific research and competitions in my lab.
title: Aeriva: A Mini Autonomous Quadrotor Platform

content:
Introduction The Huashan UAV Challenge is a national competition for college students in China. The competition is held in the Huashan Mountain, Shaanxi Province. The 2023 Huashan UAV Challenge is the first time that the competition has been held. This competition requires two drones to bypass the threat area in the field and reach the target point simultaneously. The drones get their positions using UWB.
My Role I led a team of six students. I contirbuted to the system architecture of the drones, including the hardware and software.
‚ñ≤ First meeting of the team. I was sharing my ideas about the hardware architecture of the drones.
‚ñ≤ The last night before the competition. We were testing the drones all night.
‚ñ≤ One moment during the competition. The drones were flying to the target point.
Achievements ‚ñ≤ The certificate of the 1st place in the 2023 Huashan UAV Challenge.
‚ñ≤ The drones were exhibited in the 2023 Beihang University Technology Exhibition.
summary: led a team to win the 1st place in the 2023 Huashan UAV Challenge.
title: Huashan UAV Challenge - Champion

content: At the conference CACRE 2022, I was honored the Best Presenter Award for an excellent oral presentation.
summary: An RRT-based path planning algorithm enables UAVs to replan safe paths when dynamic threats emerge.
title: Adaptively Dynamic RRT*-Connect: Path Planning for UAVs Against Dynamic Obstacles

content:
I have implemented some basic SLAM algorithms on unmanned ground vehicles (UGVs) including a TurtleBot and an Ackerman mini vehicle.
TurtleBot I have implemented G-mapping on the TurtleBot.
‚ñ≤ Running G-mapping on the TurtleBot
‚ñ≤ The map generated by G-mapping
Ackerman mini vehicle I have implemented Gmapping and RTAB-Map on the Ackerman mini vehicle. I also implemented a motion planning algorithm based on Dijkstra with TEB planner to navigate it through obstacles.
‚ñ≤ The ackerman mini vehicle
‚ñ≤ Running RTAB-Map on the Ackerman mini vehicle
‚ñ≤ Navigating the Ackerman mini vehicle through obstacles using Dijkstra with TEB planner
summary: implemented some basic SLAM algorithms on a TurtleBot and an Ackerman mini vehicle.
title: SLAM Practice on Unmanned Ground Vehicles

summary: Modeled and simulated quadcopters in MATLAB and Simulink, implemented functions including position control, path following, and formation flight.
title: Modeling and Simulation for Quadcopter

summary: A novel multi-UAV mobile edge computing framework, aiming to provide better Quality-of-Service and path planning based on reinforcement learning.
title: Multi-UAV Mobile Edge Computing and Path Planning Platform Based on Reinforcement Learning

content:
Aim Use machine learning approaches to help preliminary diagnosis of chest radiographs: classify radiographs into 3 classes ‚Äì COVID, normal, and viral pneumonia with the highest possible accuracy.
Method Used transfer learning to train several models including ResNet, DenseNet, InceptionResNet, etc. on a labeled training set. Used stacking to ensemble the above models to form a stronger model. Achievement Achieved accuracy of more than 0.98. Especially, the model achieved almost 100% precision in the COVID class.
Model performance on test set
summary: Use machine learning approaches to help preliminary diagnosis of chest radiographs: classify radiographs into 3 classes ‚Äì COVID, normal, and viral pneumonia with the highest possible accuracy.
title: Radiograph Classification for Diagnosing COVID-19
